newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech cenbank says March M2 rises 7.3 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Czech cenbank says March M2 rises 7.3 pct yr/yr.

text.p: The Czech National Bank (CNB) said on Friday that its key measure of money supply, M2, rose 7.3 percent in March, year-on-year, excluding the effect of deposits in the $1.32 billion equity expansion of SPT Telecom a.s.
That compares with a rise of 7.4 percent in February, excluding the SPT factor. Including the SPT deposits, the March M2 was up 6.3 percent, versus 6.2 percent in February.
In a statement, the CNB also said that the total volume of crown and foreign currency credits granted to clients by commercial banks in March rose 9.5 percent, year-on-year, the same as in February.
The total volume of crown and foreign currency deposits grew by 5.5 percent in March, again the same as in February, the CNB said.
The average interest rate in March for new crown credits was 13.53 percent, one basis point lower than in February.
CZECH M2 MONEY MARCH 1997 FEB 1997 MARCH 1996
* Includes domestic deposits connected to the $1.32 billion equity expansion of SPT Telecom a.s. in the summer of 1995.
